授業目的:
1. To develop students’ English proficiency through the study of academic topics in the field of sociology.
2. To build students confidence in using English as a communicative tool.
3. To help students improve their listening and note-taking skills through extensive lecture-listening activities.
4. To introduce students to significant vocabulary words relevant to a wide-range of academic topics.
5. To prepare students to actively take part in discussions, teaching them the fundamental skills for agreeing and disagreeing with others’ opinions.
到達目標:
1. Students will develop their academic skills.
2. Students will become more confident and effective communicators.
3. Students will strengthen their listening comprehension, note-taking and discussion skills.
4. Students will acquire new vocabulary that will enhance their academic achievement.
特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
対面授業
1. This course will be conducted in English only and English will be the means of communication between the students and the instructor. (Students will also be expected to communicate with one another in English.)
2. Students are encouraged to actively participate in class discussions, both independently and collaboratively, in order to enhance their competence and confidence in English and also to create a better learning environment for all.

第1回: Consider follow-up questions to first day introductions.  30-45 minutes of preparation
第2回: Cultural Questions worksheet.  1 hour of out of class study.
第3回: Unit 1b: Archaeology - What Causes a Society to Collapse?
Ancient societies of the world, research and report. One hour of more of out of class study.
第4回: Unit 1b: Archaeology - What Causes a Society to Collapse?
Review of in-class vocabulary.  One hour of study.
第5回: Homework assignment: Third Culture Kids two-person dialog.  One hour or more of out of class study.
第6回: Homework:  Cultural and geographical questions.  One hour or more of study.
第7回: Review and written opinion about today's Health Science issues.  One hour of study.
第8回: Worksheet: Modern day health issues.  One hour or more of study.
第9回: Unit 4b: Business - Managing International Business Meetings
Essay writing, informative paragraphs as homework.  One hour or more of out of class study.
第10回: Unit 4b: Business - Managing International Business Meetings
Countries and People, making comparisons and contrasts.  90 minutes of study.
第11回: Review of in-class material.  Vocabulary matching exercises.  One hour of study.
第12回: Presentation preparation, submit draft for review.  90 minutes of out of class study.
第13回: Written personal reflection on this semester's course study.  One hour of study.

評価.成績評価Grading2:
備考　Note
1. Active participation is extremely important and counts as a significant part of students’ evaluation marks.
2. Attendance is crucial to students’ success in this course. The instructor will carefully mark students’ attendance as present and on time, late, or absent. Specific rules regarding attendance are as follows:
2a) Only students who are present at the time the class begins will receive full attendance marks.
2b) Any student walking into the classroom after the class has begun will be marked late. The instructor will take this into account when giving students a participation grade.
2c) Being 15 to 29 minutes late will equal half an absence (0.5).
2d) Each time students are late 30 minutes or more, they will be marked absent. However, they are still encouraged to attend.
2e) No more than three absences will be permitted in this course. Any student who is absent more than three times will automatically fail this course.
